name: SCANDINAVIAN CHRISTMAS TOY KIT by Jane Foster
description:
This kit has been designed by Jane in her studio at home in Totnes, Devon. The kit has been professionally screen printed here in the UK onto a crisp white cotton. 

The kit contains fabric to make the 4 toys shown in the photo along with a set of instructions. These could be made with or without a sewing machine - they're very easy to assemble.

A medium bag of polyester stuffing is required.

The large Angel is 22cm tall, Father Christmas is 21cm tall, Mrs Christmas is 23cm and the mini Angel 12cm tall. 

 A perfect size for popping into a Christmas Stocking and for cuddling!

This Haiku calendar is Muumuru’s own version of Haiku poetry. 

In this calendar there is a poem and a colourful illustration for each months nature’s season.

Design by MUUMURU.

name: Pappelina Rug - Vivi
description:
Made in Sweden by Pappelina.

These extremely versatile, stylish and durable rugs can be used inside and out.
They are made from plastic with a traditional weaving technique born in 1948 and modernised by Pappelina in 1999.
The weaving takes place on old traditional shuttle looms and each rug is created as close to the original handmade style as possible. They are produced using PVC plastic and polyester warp that is produced in Sweden.


They are non slip, easy to clean, reversible, soft and warm underfoot, and long lasting. 

Pappelina believe that simplicity lasts and these rugs are a combination of high quality simplicity and functional design.



Care instructions:
Can be hand washed or machine washed at 30c or rinsed in the shower.
Reshape when wet, taking extra care with the edges, and drip dry.


UK delivery £9.95
Please contact us for the delivery prices outside UK.

name: Pappelina Rug - Mira
description:
Made in Sweden by Pappelina.

These extremely versatile, stylish and durable rugs can be used inside and out.
They are made from plastic with a traditional weaving technique born in 1948 and modernised by Pappelina in 1999.
The weaving takes place on old traditional shuttle looms and each rug is created as close to the original handmade style as possible. They are produced using PVC plastic and polyester warp that is produced in Sweden.


They are non slip, easy to clean, reversible, soft and warm underfoot, and long lasting. 

Pappelina believe that simplicity lasts and these rugs are a combination of high quality simplicity and functional design.



Care instructions:
Can be hand washed or machine washed at 30c or rinsed in the shower.
Reshape when wet, taking extra care with the edges, and drip dry.


UK delivery £9.95

name: Elephants - Elefantti Cushions
description:
Elephants or Elephantti cushions in yellow & blue.

A famous finnish design by Laina Koskela from 1969. 

One of the all time great pillow designs.

Happily now back in production by the quality brand, Finlayson, Finland.

The quilted cover is made from 100% cotton. Size 48cmX48cm. 



Machine washable.

45cm x 45 cm.

Comes with a polyester cluster fibre inner cushion.

name: Kånken - Swedish Backpack
description:
The classic Swedish Kånken backsack.

Designed in 1978, by Åke Nordin, originally to prevent the back problems experienced by children carrying heavy shoulder bags to school.
 
Now, like the British Brompton bicycle, the Fjällräven Kånken backpack has grown into a legend. 

Made from Vinylon F, Kånken is durable, seemingly immortal, and due to it’s unique quality, like a Barbour jacket, it just looks better with age.

Vinylon F swells like a natural fibre, making the weave more dense when it's raining. This gives the fabric waterproof qualities inherent in it’s  construction, eliminating the need for a coating.

Features;
The large main compartment has a large opening which makes it easy to put in/take out items. There are two side pockets and a zippered pocket at the front. The rucksack has a handle at the top, narrow, supple shoulder straps, removable sitting pad in the pocket in the back and logo that doubles as a reflector.

Weight   290g
Depth    13cm
Height   38cm
Width    27cm
Volume  Approx 16L
Pockets 2 x side , zippered front

name: Danish Industrial Clip-On Lamp
description:
We spotted this Industrial clip-on lamp in an episode of Borgen in Kasper's flat, & managed to track it down.

It's an easy & original way to shed some light above your desk, over your bed as a reading lamp or to illuminate that thing you love on your shelf.

The clip makes it extremely versatile.

From lamp to clip it's approximately 30cm, the metal shade is about 20cm long and the cable is 2m long.

£5.95

In 1969 Simon Karkov designed this iconic, futuristic lamp, consisting of 69 parts: The Norm 69 Lamp.

Made in Denmark, this classic piece of Danish design comes flat-packed and requires self assembly. It consists of 69 polypropylene pieces that slot together without the use of tools or glue.

Norm 69 looks cool during the day, and spectacular at night.



Four sizes are available to fit any room;
Small 42cm diameter
Large 51cm diameter

Norm 69 can fit onto existing light fittings or you can buy new Norm 69 flex, plastic rose and bulb holder from our drop down menu.

name: iittala Kastehelmi Votives
description:
Designed by one of the greatest names in Finnish glass, Professor Oiva Toikka, in 1964.

Manufactured by iittala, Finland.

Kastehelmi is the Finnish word for Dewdrop.

The name refers to the circles of bubbles pressed into the glass of the votives.

Here two elements are combined, water & fire, creating magical reflections & dancing dewdrops when lit.

Choose between clear, grey, water green, light blue or sand colour or choose a combination of colours.

They measure 8cm in diameter & 6.5cm tall.

In stock & ready for delivery.

description:
Designed by hugely popular Marianne Westman from Sweden who took inspiration from her close surroundings and often designed items she found to be useful in her own kitchen. 
This little drinks tray is perfect for those summer evenings when you wish you were by the lake watching the sun set and sipping wine!

name: iittala Ultima Thule
description:
Designed by Tapio Wirkkala in 1968, made by iittala, Finland.

Inspired by the melting ice in Lapland, Tapio Wirkkala originally carved the mould for these glasses from wood. 

The patterns on the glasses made gradually change over time as the molten glass burns the surface of the wooden moulds.

We have the On-The-Rocks glass, 28cl, great for whiskey & we have the Goblet, 34cl, a great beer glass.

Both are in stock & both are ready to go.

The glasses come in a set of two.

name: iittala Essence Wine Glasses
description:
What started as a glass factory in Iittala, Finland, now celebrates generations of essential objects that are made to enrich people’s everyday lives.

The Essence range is designed by Alfredo Häberli, & made by Iittla.

The design of these fine glasses follows the ideal that everyday objects should be practical and beautiful.

Essence has a sense of balance not only in the individual glass but across the whole range, with the base & stems being the same size from the Champagne glass, through to the red wine glass.

They are a pleasure to use 

Made with very fine glass, they are dishwasher safe, but we always hand wash ours.

We have in stock, champagne, white wine & red wine glasses.
They are sold as pairs.

Hygienic and washable in up to 90 degrees C. 
This durable & long lasting product was invented in 1949 by genius Mr Curt Lindqvist whose invention is a must in every kitchen!

Inspired by English afternoon tea, Tea for One Table invites you to bring a time-honoured tradition into the most modern of homes. Perfect for holding a single cup of tea or coffee, a muffin, or a plate of sliced fruit, this table literally puts snack time on a pedestal.

Stereotypes, clichés and typecasts help to build an archetypical map of text to chart the infinitely diverse character of the British Isles. The designers, Angus Mcarthur and Alison Hardcastle, have turned a jumbled lists of words into a lovingly hand drawn map which is as full of personality as the landscape that it covers.

name: Reindeer Hide.
description:
From Rovaniemi, in Finnish Lapland, these premium quality reindeer hides are produced by a traditional Finnish family company founded in 1969.
The reindeer they use are abundant in Lapland & as is tradition, are used for meat & clothing. The hides are a byproduct of this & are used as wall decorations, rugs, seat warmers or anything else that requires warmth & comfort. 

No two are the same & the colours vary as to what time of year the Reindeer hides were produced; whiter in the winter, darker in the summer.


These are a natural product, excessive traffic will cause hairs to break.
Colours vary and sizes vary slightly, but all are approximately 1m wide and 1.3m long.

These products are obtained and exported legally in accordance with the Finnish law and are not listed by The Convention of International Trade Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora, (CITIES).

UK mainland delivery £9.95

name: G Plan Desk- SOLD.
description:
A vintage desk by the famous brand G Plan.

Made from Teak and Afromosia circa 1960.

As with all our furniture, the desk is in superb condition, the desk top has a beautiful patina, as do the four teak drawers.

There's a cheeky little shelf in the footwell and space for magazines under the desk top.

The design is very 60's modern, made in Britain with a heavy influence from Denmark.

It measures 145cm long, 46cm deep, 73cm high and from the floor to the bottom of the desk top it's 68cm.

Viewing available by appointment.

Please contact us for delivery.

name: Vintage Furniture - Erik Buck Model 50 Arm Chair.
description:
Original model 50 arm chair in teak and oak. 

Designed by Erik Buck in 1957, manufactured in Denmark by Povl Dinesen around the same time - late 50's early 60's.

In excellent original condition. 
Really solid, really stylish.

We only have one of these, they're quite hard to find!

UK Delivery starts at £30.00.
Please contact us for a quote.

name: Vintage Furniture - G Plan Console Table- SOLD.
description:
G-Plan is the ultimate retro furniture. The G-Plan brand, launched in the 50s, defined modern furniture in the 50s, 60s and 70s. In those days most people used 'G-Plan' to describe modern furniture in the way we still use 'Hoover' to describe a vacuum cleaner. G-Plan was not cheap furniture, but G-Plan was the brand most people wanted to own.
This console table was part of the Fresco range. 

Made in teak & afromosia, circa 1970. 

It looks superb in either hallways or alcoves, a great find.

Measurements;   Height 73cm, Width 107cm, Depth 46cm.


Please contact us for delivery.

name: Vintage Furniture - Ercol Armchair Model 566/567
description:
1960's armchair designed by Lucian Ercolani.

Made in High Wycombe of beech.

New foam and wadding in original blue box cushion covers.

This chair is no longer in production & becoming rarer by the day.

It measures 70cm deep, 68cm wide & 78cm high.






Contact us for viewing or delivery details.

name: Vintage Furniture - 1950's Chest of Drawers by Morris of Glasgow - SOLD
description:
Designed by Neil Morris as part of the Cumbrae range.

Made by Morris of Glasgow in the 1950's

Australian Walnut with Beech drawer pulls, Sycamore trim and Mahogany splayed legs.

The Cumbrae range was originally intended for the boudoir, but we'd happily put this piece anywhere.

It measures, 85cm high, 79cm wide and 47cm deep.

Please contact us for delivery.

name: Chinese Lady by Vladimir Tretchikoff
description:
Original vintage 1960's print of The Chinese Lady, commonly known as the Green Lady, by Vladimir Tretchikoff.
Painted in the 50's, printed in the 60's & 70's, this was one of the first massed produced prints to travel around the world & is one of the most successful, & iconic pictures of all time.

She measures 54cm by 63cm.

Price includes delivery

name: Ingela P Arrhenius - 2D Character Parade.
description:
Designed by Swedish artist and illustrator Ingela P Arrhenius. 

Ingela is based in Sweden, and has a naive style influenced by her love of design from the 50's and 60's.

Each pack of retro characters contains 12 pre-cut sheets, which pop out and piece together, (not suitable for children under 3).

You end up with 12 fantastic characters, roughly 10cm tall, which capture the essence of Ingela's unique style.

You can't help but smile when you make them.

Animal parade also available.



UK mainland postage & packing £3.95
Everywhere else £ 5.95
